Detailed Description

Class to represent a daisy chain of boards.

Each shiftChain object stores all of the data required to create and use a daisy chained group of shift register controlled modules, devices, or boards.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

shiftChain::shiftChain ( uint8_t  boardCount,
shiftBoard **  boards,
uint8_t  dataPin,
uint8_t  clockPin,
uint8_t  latchPin,
uint8_t  resetPin 
)

Create a new daisy chain object, without an index output.

Parameters:
boardCountThe number of boards attached to the chain
**boardsAn array of pointers to the board objects. Storage for the array and the board objects must be allocated before calling the constructor, such as by declaring them statically or globally.
dataPinThe Arduino pin used to transmit data to the shift register(s). On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 13.
clockPinThe Arduino pin used to clock the shift register(s). On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 12.
latchPinThe Arduino pin used to latch the shifted data into the shift register output. On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 7.
resetPinThe Arduino pin that drives the master reset for the shift register chain. On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 8.
shiftChain::shiftChain ( uint8_t  boardCount,
shiftBoard **  boards,
uint8_t  dataPin,
uint8_t  clockPin,
uint8_t  latchPin,
uint8_t  resetPin,
uint8_t  indexPin 
)

Create a new daisy chain object, with an index output.

Parameters:
boardCountThe number of boards attached to the chain
**boardsAn array of pointers to the board objects. Storage for the array and the board objects must be allocated before calling the constructor, such as by declaring them statically or globally.
dataPinThe Arduino pin used to transmit data to the shift register(s). On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 13.
clockPinThe Arduino pin used to clock the shift register(s). On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 12.
latchPinThe Arduino pin used to latch the shifted data into the shift register output. On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 7.
resetPinThe Arduino pin that drives the master reset for the shift register chain. On the sixteen channel board, this is pin 8.
indexPinThis pin turns on while shiftChain::doTick() is running. This allows precise timing measurement.

Member Function Documentation

void shiftChain::doTick ( void   )

Do a timer tick -- call this from an ISR.

This can be called from a loop, but you get the most consistent results from calling it from an ISR, such as follows: 

  ISR (TIMER2_OVF_vect)
      {
              myChain->doTick();
      }

Calling it in this fashion gives consistent speed from stepper motors and the like.

uint8_t shiftChain::startTimer ( uint8_t  prescaler,
uint8_t  timerVal,
uint8_t  timer 
)

Start the timer.

This starts the timer directed by the timer parameter with the given pre-scaler and reset value. It also activates the overflow interrupt for the given timer.

Parameters:
prescalerSelect the timer pre-scaler. This is the value that the main processor clock is divided by to clock the timer. define values are provide for all the supported pre-scaler values:

  • __preScaler32__
  • __preScaler64__
  • __preScaler128__
  • __preScaler256__
  • __preScaler1024__ If an un-supported value is passed in here, the pre scaler defaults to 1024.
timerValThis is the value that the timer resets to after each time it overflows. The number of ticks of the timer clock between overflows is equal to maxTimerValue - timerVal. Since only 8-bit timers are supported so far, this is an 8-bit value.
timerThe timer to start. The only supported timer right now is 2; selecting any other timer will result in an error.
Returns:
Returns a 0 if timer 2 is selected; otherwise -1.
uint8_t shiftChain::stopTimer ( void   )

Shut down the current timer.

Returns:
This returns status. However, the error checking/status functionality is not implemented, so it always returns 0 (success).
